definition: to form/to organize/group/team/classifier for sets, series, groups of people, batteries
to establish/to found/to set up/to build/to construct

sentences.english: The new premier is forming his government mainly from young men.
sentences.chinese: 這位新總理主要從年輕人中物色人選組建政府。

sentences.english: Create a treasure hunt with some blogging friends.
sentences.chinese: 和一些博友組建一支尋寶隊。

sentences.english: Bayerische Landesbank is a corporation established under the German public law.
sentences.chinese: 德國巴伐利亞州銀行是一家依據德國立法組建的銀行。

sentences.english: Swing Dynasty Jazz and chanson Franaise band based in Shanghai.
sentences.chinese: 在上海組建的法國爵士和香頌。

sentences.english: In that year, the Council of Nicaea was convened by emperor Constantine.
sentences.chinese: 在那些年裏，康斯坦丁大帝組建了尼西亞理事會。

sentences.english: Construction and Analysis of the Susceptible Population Life Table of Plutella xylostella L.
sentences.chinese: 小菜蛾敏感種羣生命表的組建與分析。

sentences.english: The Center for Food Safety and Applied Nutrition had a Sugar Task Force look into these claims.
sentences.chinese: 食品安全中心爲此特別組建了一個研究小組。

sentences.english: Many former Thai Rak Thai Party members moved to establish the People's Power Party.
sentences.chinese: 許多前泰愛泰黨的成員組建了人民力量黨。

sentences.english: Three experimental population life tables of citrus black scale Par-latoria zizyphus Lucas under different humidity conditions were established.
sentences.chinese: 本文組建了黑點蚧三種溼度範圍種羣生命表。

sentences.english: The second part is the introduction of the new journey after amalgamation.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分爲新的歷程，即三峽大學合併組建後的情況。

sentences.english: The SKA will be built in the southern hemisphere with South Africa and Australia currently vying for the right to host the project.
sentences.chinese: 她又南非與澳大利亞共同組建，目前坐落於南半球。

sentences.english: In 1869, he formed the Westinghouse Air Brake Company.
sentences.chinese: 在1869年，他組建了西屋空氣制動公司。

sentences.english: I've recently started to crew for a sailboat and occasionally take part in offshore races.
sentences.chinese: 我最近開始組建一支帆船隊，並偶爾參加近海比賽。

sentences.english: Separate mechanized divisions and tank battalions for infantry divisions were also formed.
sentences.chinese: 同時獨立的機械化師和步兵師屬坦克營也開始組建。

sentences.english: Clarity and thermoformability are enhanced by the incorporation of nucleating and slip agent.
sentences.chinese: 淨度和熱成型性能，從而加強了對核和滑移代理組建。

sentences.english: The Shabab says it has set up three units of suicide-bombers.
sentences.chinese: 伊斯蘭青年黨宣稱他們已經組建了3自殺襲擊者小組。

definition: to originate/to initiate/to launch (an attack, an initiative etc)/to start/to propose sth (for the first time)
to establish (a unit or department)/staffing structure (excluding temporary and casual staff)
to open/to start (a business etc)/to set up
to push (for acceptance of a plan)/to push forward/to promote/to actuate/CL:個|个[ge4]
